intro: Canthium viguieri, commonly known as the African spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open woodlands. Due to its rapid growth and ability to spread, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
